bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to G.W. McCoy, December 3, 1924

div1.p: Carter returns a book and requests others, in Spanish, on the history of the Canary Islands.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to G.W. McCoy, December 3, 1924
div1.opener:
C Myers
Library
/L.C. Hygienic Laboratory
RECEIVED
DEC - 4 1924
The Westmoreland, Apt. 157,
2122 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
December 3, 1924.
Dear Doctor McCoy:
div1.p:
The 2nd. volume of the History of Brazil by Southey, which you
so kindly procured for me from the Library of Congress, is ready to go
back whenever it is convenient for you to send for it. When you do so,
I should also be glad to have the following books:

row.cell: Contes du Chevalier de la Morliere, Angola.
Historia insulana das ihlas a Portugal.

Consideraciones historicas acerca de
las Islas Canarias.

Conquista y Antiquedades de las islas
de la Gran Canaria.

Africa Occidental: noticias y considera-
ciones.

Caracter de las conquista y colonizacion
de las islas Canarias.

div1.p:
I will be at home every day this week, with the exception of to-
morrow morning and early afternoon, which I purpose to spend at the
Library.

With very best wishes to you and yours, in which Laura, who is
writing this joins.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, H. R. Carter Put dam student
III = 3.75
